eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label text.

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AnimationSystem
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds easy to use pre-made animations.
description: Helpful for making animations for sprites without having to spend time animating the character in editors
-You can use multi animations on one object to get more effects
-For the animations that do Not have Trigger once, you can use Timers to make it Have one !
-Added condition to check if the door is Open or Close from animation (3D open/close door)
-Added condition to check if the animation has finished (if trigger once set to YES)
-User can change the origin point of the object to control the animations
-Animation behavior must be installed in the object to make the extension works

eventsFunctions.description: From *3D open door* animation.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if the door is open
eventsFunctions.name: DoorIsOpen

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the selected animation has finished.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if the animation has finished
eventsFunctions.name: AnimationFinished

parameters.longDescription: Animation must be set to Trigger once in order to check if it finished
parameters.name: animations
parameters.supplementaryInformation: ["Pulse","Breath","Smooth rotation","Instant rotation","3D rotation","3D rotation X","3D rotation Y","Float","Triangle transition","Square transition","Rhombus transition","Maze transition","Fade out","Fade in","Squash & Stretch","Rainbow effect","Shake rotation","Shake horizontal","Shake vertical","Line rotation","Land","Low health"]

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate any sprite with this extension.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AnimationBehavior

eventsFunctions.description: edit the object ("Origin" point) to control how the animation goes.
eventsFunctions.name: AnimationSystem
eventsFunctions.sentence: Animate _PARAM0_ with animation _PARAM2_ at speed _PARAM3_ on width _PARAM4_ and height _PARAM5_ Trigger once? _PARAM6_

parameters: lerp(Object.Y(), Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Squash and Stretch Y) ,GetArgumentAsNumber("speed")*5)
lerp(Object.Y(), Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Squash and Stretch Y) ,GetArgumentAsNumber("speed")*5)

ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color)) + ";" + ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color RGB)) + ";" + ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color RGB))

ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color)) + ";" + ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color RGB)) + ";" + ToString(Object.Variable(_.Animation system._Low health color RGB))

parameters.name: animations
parameters.supplementaryInformation: ["Pulse","Breath","Smooth rotation","Instant rotation","Wobble","Wobble2","Wobble3","Wobble once","3D rotation","3D rotation X","3D rotation Y","3D door loop","3D open door","3D close door","3D pre-closed door","Float","Triangle transition","Square transition","Rhombus transition","Maze transition","Fade loop","Fade out","Fade in","Squash & Stretch","Rainbow effect","Shake rotation","Shake horizontal","Shake vertical","Line rotation","Land","Low health"]

parameters.longDescription:
Animations information:  
Pulse/Breath: recommended speed, 0.03  
Smooth rotation: recommended speed, 5  
Wobble/wobble2/wobble3: Do not have trigger once/ recommended speed, 0.1  
Wobble once: Trigger once must be YES/ recommended speed, 0.1  
3D rotation: recommended speed, 1  
3D rotationX: recommended speed, 1.2  
3D rotationY: Origin point must be at center/ recommended speed, 1.2  
3D door loop: do not have trigger once/ recommended speed, 1.2  
3D open/close door: Trigger once must be YES/ recommended speed, 1.2  
3D pre-closed door: Trigger once must be YES/ speed doesn't matter  
Float: recommended speed, 0.02  
Triangle/Square/Rhombus/Maze transition: recommended speed, 3  
Fade loop: do not have trigger once/ recommended speed, 5  
Fade Out/In: Trigger once must be YES/ recommended speed, 5  
Squash&Stretch: recommended speed, 0.06  
Rainbow effect: The higher the speed the slower effect/ recommended speed, 1  
Shake rotation/Horizontal/Vertical: recommended speed, 4  
Line rotation: recommended speed, 3  
Land: Trigger once must be YES/ Best results, set the condition of the player to "is on floor" > start animation land / recommended speed, 5  
Low health: recommended speed, 30
parameters.name: height

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
Firing bullets:
- Cooldown: Time between shots (seconds)
- Bullet Quantity: Number of bullets created each time Fire Bullet action is used.
- Firing Arc: Range of angles (in degrees) that bullets will shoot. Bullets are evenly spread within this range.
- Rotate bullet: Change the angle of each bullet to match the direction it is travelling (enabled by default)
- Angle Variance: Each bullet trajectory will be adjusted by a random value within this range (degrees)
- Bullet speed variance: Each bullet speed will be adjusted by a random value within this range (pixels/second)
Ammo:
- Starting ammo
- Max ammo
- Shots per reload. Use 0 to disable reloading
- Reload duration
- Automatic reloading is enabled by default, but it can also be done manually.
Overheat:
- Heat increase per shot. Object is Overheated when Heat reaches  1.
- Cooling rate per second
- When overheated, the object cannot fire any bullets
Statistics:
- Total bullets created
- Total shots taken
- Total reloads completed

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Increase heat (if needed)
Check if this caused overheat
Detect when reload is completed
Only reload the amount of ammo available

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health points and damage, including a protective shield and armor.
description: Manage health points including a protective shield and armor. Health can be assigned to players, enemies, NPCs, or even inanimate objects such as breaking doors and mining rocks.
Damage calculations are performed in this order:
Incoming Damage -> Is Damage Cooldown active? -> Chance to Dodge -> Flat Damage Reduction -> Percent Damage Reduction -> Damage to Shield -> Damage to Health
How to use:
- Set desired values in behavior properties
- To apply damage use “Apply damage to an object”
- To heal health, use “Heal object” action
- To activate the shield, use “Activate shield” action
- Health and shield regeneration will happen automatically based on properties
Tips:
- While damage cooldown is active, no damage will be applied to health or shield (the object is invincible)
- Try using the “Blink” extension while damage cooldown is active
- Use the “Is just damaged” or "Is just healed" conditions to trigger sound and visual effects
Health properties:
- Starting health points
- Maximum health points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
- Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
Shield properties:
- Max shield points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
- Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Block excess damage when shield is broken (yes/no)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points including a protective shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

events.comment: Health

Shield

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object. Shield and armor can reduce this damage if enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Apply _PARAM2_ points of damage to _PARAM0_ (Damage can be reduced by Shield: _PARAM3_, Armor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Only consider incoming damage when damage cooldown is not active
No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctions.description: Change maximum shield points.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxShieldPoints
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the maximum shield points on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) blocking excess damage when shield breaks.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Block excess damage when shield breaks
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldBlockExcessDamage
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shield on _PARAM0_ blocks excess damage when it breaks: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the shield was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsShieldJustDamaged
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shield on _PARAM0_ has just been damaged

eventsFunctions.description: Check if incoming damage was just dodged.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDodged

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the shield is active (based on shield points and duration).
eventsFunctions.name: IsShieldActive

events.comment: To be considered "active", a shield must have positive points AND not exceed duration
Don't check the timer when duration is zero (or negative)

eventsFunctions.description: maximum shield points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxShield

eventsFunctions.description: Duration of the shield (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldRegenDelay

eventsFunctions.description: Rate of shield regeneration (points per second).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldRegenRate

eventsFunctions.description: Time before the shield duration ends (seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldTimeRemaining

eventsFunctions.description: current shield points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: ShieldPoints

eventsFunctions.description: Shield damage taken from most recent hit.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Shield damage taken from most recent hit
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousDamageToShield

eventsFunctions.description: Health points gained from previous heal.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Health points gained from previous heal
eventsFunctions.name: PreviousHealAmount

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum health (points) Use "0" for no maximum
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxHealth

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageCooldown

propertyDescriptors.label: Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: HealthRegenRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: HealthRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
propertyDescriptors.name: AllowOverHealing

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum shield (points) Use "0" for no maximum
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxShieldPoints

propertyDescriptors.label: Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Block excess damage when shield is broken
propertyDescriptors.name: BlockExcessDamage

propertyDescriptors.label: Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Chance to dodge incoming damage (Range: 0 to 1) If damage is dodged, no damage is applied
propertyDescriptors.name: ChanceToDodge

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage to health from the previous incoming damage
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageToBeApplied

propertyDescriptors.label: Flat damage reduction from armor (incoming damage is reduced by this value)
propertyDescriptors.name: FlatDamageReduction

propertyDescriptors.label: Percentage damage reduction from armor (Range: 0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: PercentDamageReduction

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage to shield from the previous incoming damage
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldDamageTaken

propertyDescriptors.label: Health points gained from the previous heal
propertyDescriptors.name: HealToBeApplied
